protein.specific_function: Core component of multiple SCF-like ECS (Elongin-Cullin 2/5-SOCS-box protein) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complexes, which mediate the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins. As a scaffold protein may contribute to catalysis through positioning of the substrate and the ubiquitin- conjugating enzyme. The functional specificity of the E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex depends on the variable substrate recognition component. ECS(SOCS1) seems to direct ubiquitination of JAk2. Seems to be involved poteosomal degradation of p53/TP53 stimulated by adenovirus E1B-55 kDa protein. May form a cell surface vasopressin receptor

reference.reference_text: Byrd PJ, Stankovic T, McConville CM, Smith AD, Cooper PR, Taylor AM: Identification and analysis of expression of human VACM-1, a cullin gene family member located on chromosome 11q22-23. Genome Res. 1997 Jan;7(1):71-5.
